Welcome

I’m Mark Reid, a 30-something Australian, academic, husband, programmer, father, snowboarder, and web-nerd—amongst other things. You can find out more about be by poking around the links above and below.

Research

My day job is as a Research Fellow in statistical machine learning at the Australian National University’s Research School of Information Sciences and Engineering.

Blogs

I keep a research blog called Inductio ex Machina on machine learning and statistics. Recent posts include:

  • MetaOptimize Q+A 03 Jul 2010
  • ICML 2010 Discussion Site 22 Jun 2010
  • Prediction Services 21 May 2010

I have also just started a programming blog called Structure & Process.

  • A Java Sightseer's Guide to Clojure 14 Mar 2010
  • Online Learning in Clojure 14 Jul 2009
  • Minilight in Clojure: Triangles 11 Apr 2009
